reviews.review_msg: Good teacher and really passionate about what she is teaching.  Midterm wasn't too bad, and the assignment was pretty interesting! Would recommend this class!
So far...I've always gotten A- ~ A+ papers... She gave me C.****. She is a nice person though. But really hard marker. Should I get it reevaluated or something?
Her exams are fair and easy. However, she is such a hard marker on term-paper.
She is a sweet, kind and even funny person..Her lectures are very well organized and she records the lectures. Her exams are fair and not hard. I recommend her for sure !
Be warned: she grades very easily on the first assignment, and very difficult on the rest. this strategy really, really screwed me over.

Sweet woman, really passionate about what she's doing. Sometimes her die-hard feminism became a little exhausting, in open-forum converations I detected a bit of scoffing towards some males in the class, simply because they were males. Which wasn't cool. But a very warm woman with lot's of info. You will take many notes in this class.

Sarah is an amazing prof, probably one of my favorites at sfu. She makes the class content interesting and you can tell she genuinely cares about it. She was always open to questions and even let us make up a question/answer key for the final. Great prof would deff recommend.
this was for CRIM 304 - she was so amazing but her grading scale is intense. no final exam tho which is amazing!
Overall good prof, would definitley take her class again.
She is bar far the best prof ever at SFU. Took 131 and 213 crim classes with her and she made understanding material super easy. Most caring prof ever.

Danielle is one of the best profs I have had at SFU. Her lectures are interesting, easy to follow and you can tell she really cares about her students. She is very clear with what she expects students to know for exams and is accessible both in person and through email if you need any extra help. I highly recommend taking CRIM 213 with her.

One of my favourite prof at SFU. She genuinely cares about her students succeeding and learning. After we switched to remote tutorials because of Covid-19 she was so helpful and organized. Her lectures are all well planned and actually help you. Her assignments and tests were all graded fairly and her the questions were never meant to trick you

She is very clear with the exams and what she wants on the term paper. You have to study a lot to prepare for the exams because she does pull on small details. If you take this class you have to have time for it. Great lectures and very caring about her students' success.

Literally made an account just to rate her. Best crim prof at SFU! She cares about her students succeeding not only in the course, but in their careers going forward. Very clear in her lecturing style and of what she expects. Approachable and always encourages folks to ask for help. Definitely recommend any class with her!

Pam was amazing! Her lectures were very applicable to the 'real world,' she really cared about the material and made it easy & digestible for us. Lectures aren't recorded so you really need to go to lecture but lectures are actually fun! The only bad thing is that the MC portion of the final was very difficult, & she tends to go on tangents.

Pam is an incredibly caring prof. She is approachable, knowledgable, and above all, she is truly invested in the success of her students. Pam has been such a wonderful addition to the SFU staff. I hope I can take more classes with her in the future.

Pam is probably one of the best profs I have ever had. You can tell she has a passion for what she is teaching which made me excited to come to class every week. If you ever get the opportunity to take a class with Pam I highly suggest it!!

Pam is a phenomenal professor!! She enjoys the material she teaches & genuinely cares about her students, which can be seen in her conduction of the class. She made learning enjoyable & presents the material in a way that is incredibly engaging & easy to understand. She also had wrongfully convicted women come in & guest lecture which was amazing!

This class was on Women in the criminal justice system and Pam made it the coolest course ever. I'm very lucky I had her as a prof. She gives a point of view that you never would've thought of. She is insightful and so kind.

She is great! Super chill, very approachable. So much more conversation with her than other profs Ive had. The material is interesting, and she makes learning it so much more fun. Loved the response papers, because it makes you want to pay attention to branch off on even the smallest idea from a lecture. Would definitely take with her again
Pam is a great professor! I really enjoyed her lectures and the assignments that she gave out. Gives great feedbacks.
VERY good at making us critical thinkers. She actually cares a lot about her students and is a fair marker. Phenomenal speaker and lecturer.

Sarah is THE BEST professor (and she's actually a PhD candidate not prof). She is cool, relatable, involves the class all the time, includes both her own slides and textbook readings. Is passionate about what she does and what she teaches. Her exams literally are half lecture half textbook so if you take her class do your readings!

Dr. Yercich is amazing! By far the best prof I have ever had! She brought dry and boring material to life. She was always accessible and willing to answer any questions I brought forward. She clearly explained all concepts and was even willing to help me the night before the exam when I frantically emailed her with questions!

Sarah is BOSS. Always always ALWAYS willing, available to help students. I emailed her the night before the exam for help, she responded within a half an hour. Very very VERY helpful, caring. SUPER good lectures, makes you think. My FAVOURITE class by a landslide. Clear expectations. Really interesting and knowledgeable. All around nice person.

Her class is amazing. My fav class Ive taken at SFU. Great content and passionate prof. The assignments take some work but are doable. I owe a lot to Prof Y. She isnt out of touch with her students and was understanding of my situation. She made many accommodations for me while I was going thru some court stuff which none of my other profs did.

This class was frustrating to say the least. Boring lectures, hard grader and tests are long. She expected us to answer MC/ SA/TF questions and write a novel in an hour and a half. She then said had the unmitigated gall to tell me I need to be more "efficient." Average grades on tests/papers are about a C-. BTW she is a huge liberal and feminist.

I'm a gender studies and crim student. This was the first class that merged both of my interests. Sarah was excellent, critical & engaging. Explained this well and is really interesting. Fair grader. The only ppl who didn't like this class were people who don't appreciate feminism. Don't take a gender class if you can't tolerate feminism.
